COMPANY, LIMITED; ^ This Company’s system of submarine telegraph cables is the most direct and quickest means of communication from Egypt to Eumpe, North and South America, East, South and West Africa, India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan. For latest average time to London, see daily bulletin in this paper. STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria. Cairo, Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Said, Suakjn. Head Office. London.

Peninsular and Oriental S. N. Company. Summer Retee will be charged from 2 May to 31 October. For the convenience of families and others,a large portion of each ship’s accommodation has been reserved for Egypt, so that Berths can be definitely engaged at once, as if the voyage wore commencing at Port 8aid. Plans can be seen at the Offices of the Company s Agents. Tho through Steamers for Marseilles and London are intended to loave Port Said after tho arrival of the 11 a.m. train from Cairo, every Monday until Juno, and then every I nesday. A steam tendor will meet the train to convey passengers to the ship. Passengers can go on board the evening before. The Fare remains as usual. For all farther information apply to the Company’s Agents, Messrs. Thos. Cook & Son (Egypt) Ltd............ .... CAIRO. GREECE - TURKEY LINE. Express steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIR2EU8, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London. PALESTINE - SYRIA UNE. Fast steamers leavo Alexandria overy Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port 8aid every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damasoas), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate works to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus). red sea UNE. Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSO- WAH, HODEIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIM direct Calls will be made at TOR (for Monnt 8inai) as required N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the nse of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free. Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at Thos. Cook & Son or other Tourist Agency. 31-12-904
